page.title: 04THE BLUEBELL STEAM-RAILWAY 2
page.content: British Railway closed the railway in 1959.A society then formed and the track was then bought in 1960 and re- opened.People laughed because they were the first to buy a standard gauge track from B.R.The line was named by the society 'The Bluebell Railway' because in May it is covered in bluebells.However,most of the engines were named by B.R. for instance 'Stephanie' which was built in 1872. The Railway is a charity although what profit there is, is used to restore and extend it. An extension is planned and when it is opened, meals will be served on board. In winter trains run 3 times a day, but in summer, they run every 40 minutes from 10.30-18.00. Although some engines were bought cheaply from a scrap-yard, and restored, it still costs a pound per mile to run the trains.
